013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;

018import java.util.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;

024/**
025 * Describes a single HTTP header.
026 *
027 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
028 * <p class='bcode'>
029 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
030 *    HeaderInfo x = <jsm>headerInfo</jsm>(<js>"integer"</js>).description(<js>"The number of allowed requests in the current period"</js>);
031 *
032 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
033 *    String json = JsonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toString(x);
034 *
035 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
036 *    String json = x.toString();
037 * </p>
038 * <p class='bcode'>
039 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
040 *    {
041 *       <js>"description"</js>: <js>"The number of allowed requests in the current period"</js>,
042 *       <js>"type"</js>: <js>"integer"</js>
043 *    }
044 * </p>
045 */
046@Bean(properties="description,explode,deprecated,allowEmptyValue,allowReserved,schema,example,examples,$ref,*")
047@FluentSetters
048public class HeaderInfo extends OpenApiElement {
049
050   private String
051      description,
052      ref;
053   private Boolean
054      required,
055      explode,
056      deprecated,
057      allowEmptyValue,
058      allowReserved;
059   private SchemaInfo schema;
060   private Object example;
061   private Map<String,Example> examples;
062
063
064   /**
065    * Default constructor.
066    */
067   public HeaderInfo() {}
068
069   /**
070    * Copy constructor.
071    *
072    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
073    */
074   public HeaderInfo(HeaderInfo copyFrom) {
075      super(copyFrom);
076
077      this.description = copyFrom.description;
078      this.example = copyFrom.example;
079      this.allowEmptyValue = copyFrom.allowEmptyValue;
080      this.schema = copyFrom.schema;
081      this.allowReserved = copyFrom.allowReserved;
082      this.required = copyFrom.required;
083      this.ref = copyFrom.ref;
084      this.explode = copyFrom.explode;
085      this.deprecated = copyFrom.deprecated;
086      this.examples = copyOf(copyFrom.examples, Example::copy);
087   }
088
089   /**
090    * Make a deep copy of this object.
091    *
092    * @return A deep copy of this object.
093    */
094   public HeaderInfo copy() {
095      return new HeaderInfo(this);
096   }
097
098   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
099   protected HeaderInfo strict() {
100      super.strict();
101      return this;
102   }
103
104   /**
105    * Bean property getter:  <property>description</property>.
106    *
107    * <p>
108    * A short description of the header.
109    *
110    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
111    */
112   public String getDescription() {
113      return description;
114   }
115
116   /**
117    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
118    *

120    * A short description of the header.
121    *

123    *    The new value for this property.
124    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
125    * @return This object
126    */
127   public HeaderInfo setDescription(String value) {
128      description = value;
129      return this;
130   }
131
132   /**
133    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.

136    * The type of the object.
137    *
138    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
139    */
140   public Boolean getRequired() {
141      return required;
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Bean property setter:  <property>required</property>.
146    *
147    * <p>
148    * The type of the object.
149    *
150    * @param value
151    *    The new value for this property.
152    *    <br>Property value is required.
153    *    <br>Valid values:
154    *    <ul>
155    *       <li><js>"string"</js>
156    *       <li><js>"number"</js>
157    *       <li><js>"integer"</js>
158    *       <li><js>"boolean"</js>
159    *       <li><js>"array"</js>
160    *    </ul>
161    * @return This object
162    */
163   public HeaderInfo setRequired(Boolean value) {
164      required = value;
165      return this;
166   }
167
168   /**
169    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.
170    *
171    * <p>
172    * The type of the object.
173    *
174    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
175    */
176   public Boolean getExplode() {
177      return explode;
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Bean property setter:  <property>explode</property>.
182    *
183    * <p>
184    * The type of the object.
185    *

188    * @return This object
189    */
190   public HeaderInfo setExplode(Boolean value) {
191      explode = value;
192      return this;
193   }

196    * Bean property getter:  <property>deprecated</property>.
197    *
198    * <p>
199    * The type of the object.
200    *
201    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
202    */
203   public Boolean getDeprecated() {
204      return deprecated;
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Bean property setter:  <property>deprecated</property>.
209    *

217   public HeaderInfo setDeprecated(Boolean value) {
218      deprecated = value;
219      return this;
220   }
221
222   /**
223    * Bean property getter:  <property>allowEmptyValue</property>.
224    *
225    * <p>
226    * The type of the object.
227    *
228    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
229    */
230   public Boolean getAllowEmptyValue() {
231      return allowEmptyValue;
232   }
233

235    * Bean property setter:  <property>allowEmptyValue</property>.

237    * <p>
238    * The type of the object.
239    *

242    * @return This object
243    */
244   public HeaderInfo setAllowEmptyValue(Boolean value) {
245      allowEmptyValue = value;
246      return this;
247   }

250    * Bean property getter:  <property>allowReserved</property>.

257   public Boolean getAllowReserved() {
258      return allowReserved;
259   }

282      return schema;

292    */
293   public HeaderInfo setSchema(SchemaInfo value) {
294      schema = value;
295      return this;
296   }

298   /**
299    * Bean property getter:  <property>$ref</property>.
300    *
301    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
302    */
303   @Beanp("$ref")
304   public String getRef() {
305      return ref;
306   }
307
308   /**
309    * Bean property setter:  <property>$ref</property>.

311    * @param value
312    *    The new value for this property.
313    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
314    * @return This object
315    */
316   @Beanp("$ref")
317   public HeaderInfo setRef(String value) {
318      ref = value;
319      return this;
320   }
321
322   /**
323    * Bean property getter:  <property>x-example</property>.
324    *
325    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
326    */
327   @Beanp("x-example")
328   public Object getExample() {
329      return example;
330   }
331
332   /**
333    * Bean property setter:  <property>examples</property>.
334    *
335    * @param value
336    *    The new value for this property.
337    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
338    * @return This object
339    */
340   @Beanp("x-example")
341   public HeaderInfo setExample(Object value) {
342      example = value;
343      return this;
344   }
345
346   /**
347    * Bean property getter:  <property>examples</property>.
348    *
349    * <p>
350    * The list of possible responses as they are returned from executing this operation.
351    *
352    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
353    */
354   public Map<String,Example> getExamples() {
355      return examples;
356   }
357
358   /**
359    * Bean property setter:  <property>headers</property>.
360    *
361    * <p>
362    * A list of examples that are sent with the response.
363    *
364    * @param value
365    *    The new value for this property.
366    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
367    * @return This object
368    */
369   public HeaderInfo setExamples(Map<String,Example> value) {
370      examples = copyOf(value);
371      return this;
372   }
373
374   /**
375    * Adds a single value to the <property>examples</property> property.
376    *
377    * @param name The example name.
378    * @param example The example.
379    * @return This object
380    */
381   public HeaderInfo addExample(String name, Example example) {
382      examples = mapBuilder(examples).sparse().add(name, example).build();
383      return this;
384   }
385
386   // <FluentSetters>
387
388   // </FluentSetters>
389
390   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
391   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
392      if (property == null)
393         return null;
394      return switch (property) {
395         case "description" -> (T)getDescription();
396         case "required" -> toType(getRequired(), type);
397         case "explode" -> toType(getExplode(), type);
398         case "deprecated" -> toType(getDeprecated(), type);
399         case "allowEmptyValue" -> toType(getAllowEmptyValue(), type);
400         case "allowReserved" -> toType(getAllowReserved(), type);
401         case "$ref" -> toType(getRef(), type);
402         case "schema" -> toType(getSchema(), type);
403         case "x-example" -> toType(getExample(), type);
404         case "examples" -> toType(getExamples(), type);
405         default -> super.get(property, type);
406      };
407   }
408
409   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
410   public HeaderInfo set(String property, Object value) {
411      if (property == null)
412         return this;
413      return switch (property) {
414         case "description" -> setDescription(Utils.s(value));
415         case "required" -> setRequired(toBoolean(value));
416         case "explode" -> setExplode(toBoolean(value));
417         case "deprecated" -> setDeprecated(toBoolean(value));
418         case "allowEmptyValue" -> setAllowEmptyValue(toBoolean(value));
419         case "$ref" -> setRef(Utils.s(value));
420         case "schema" -> setSchema(toType(value, SchemaInfo.class));
421         case "x-example" -> setExample(Utils.s(value));
422         case "examples" -> setExamples(mapBuilder(String.class,Example.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
423         default -> {
424            super.set(property, value);
425            yield this;
426         }
427      };
428   }
429
430   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
431   public Set<String> keySet() {
432      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
433         .addIf(description != null, "description")
434         .addIf(required != null, "required")
435         .addIf(explode != null, "explode")
436         .addIf(deprecated != null, "deprecated")
437         .addIf(allowEmptyValue != null, "allowEmptyValue")
438         .addIf(ref != null, "$ref")
439         .addIf(allowReserved != null, "allowReserved")
440         .addIf(schema != null, "schema")
441         .addIf(example != null, "example")
442         .addIf(examples != null, "examples")
443         .build();
444      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
445
446   }
447
448   /**
449    * Resolves any <js>"$ref"</js> attributes in this element.
450    *
451    * @param openApi The swagger document containing the definitions.
452    * @param refStack Keeps track of previously-visited references so that we don't cause recursive loops.
453    * @param maxDepth
454    *    The maximum depth to resolve references.
455    *    <br>After that level is reached, <code>$ref</code> references will be left alone.
456    *    <br>Useful if you have very complex models and you don't want your swagger page to be overly-complex.
457    * @return
458    *    This object with references resolved.
459    *    <br>May or may not be the same object.
460    */
461   public HeaderInfo resolveRefs(OpenApi openApi, Deque<String> refStack, int maxDepth) {
462
463      if (ref != null) {
464         if (refStack.contains(ref) || refStack.size() >= maxDepth)
465            return this;
466         refStack.addLast(ref);
467         var r = openApi.findRef(ref, HeaderInfo.class);
468         r = r.resolveRefs(openApi, refStack, maxDepth);
469         refStack.removeLast();
470         return r;
471      }
472      return this;
473   }
474}
